item.title: Pensions Supervisor
item.description:
The purpose of this role is to supervise the administration team of a Pensions Company.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

1) Ensuring efficient communication with prospective and existing customers, transferring schemes and service providers;

2) Setting up terms of business with service providers;

3) Communicating with other departments within the company;

4) Ensuring that cases are followed up efficiently;

5) Monitoring the progress of the processing of transfer requests from transferring schemes;

6) Monitoring scheme accounts on a daily basis;

7) Ensuring that payment requests and investment and disinvestment requests are processed efficiently;

8) Ensuring timely reporting to authorities;

9) Maintaining an updated training register for the company.

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Experience in administering Qualifying Recognised Overseas Pension Schemes (QROPS), knowledge of the local regulatory framework, good customer service and communication skills and the ability to motivate and lead a team are essential.

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Allison at finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Sales & Business Development Officers
item.description:
In support of planned business growth our client is currently looking to hire two Sales & Business Development professionals (one senior; one junior) to join their Malta office.

This is a challenging and varied role with responsibilities including:

  • Identify, pursue and close sales opportunities with new leads and existing clients
  • Conduct client meetings across the range of Company products within the EMEA & US region
  • Coordinate software demos highlighting the benefits and features of our cutting-edge compliance software tools
  • Generate sales proposals and work closely with senior management in order to close deals
  • Source new and alternative distribution channels
  • Develop new business ideas
  • Develop strong relationships with other industry groups and service providers

Key Experience / Skills:

  • A graduate degree in any field including accounting or legal or banking
  • For the senior hire, a proven track record of sales in financial services industry is necessary; experience of the asset management sector would be highly beneficial
  • For the junior hire, a track record in sales and / or sales support roles is required
  • Self-motivated, results-oriented individual with an eye for detail
  • Exceptional English communication and presentation skills
  • Strong organisational and follow up skills a must (including use of a CRM to track sales efforts) 
  • Great IT skills; experience with MS Dynamics CRM a plus

The successful candidates will benefit from an attractive remuneration package commensurate with qualifications and experience, together with the opportunity to become part of an energetic team in a well-structured and growing organisation operating in the asset management sector in Malta and across the globe.

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Allison to finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Branch Officer (Insurance)
item.description:
A prominent Maltese Insurance Company is seeking a Branch Officer to manage a portfolio of existing clients, with the aim of maintaining existing business as well as creating and optimising new business opportunities.

This post involves dealing in all classes of business including claims handling and the chosen candidate will gain wide-ranging experience in underwriting, sales and claims.

Skills and experience required:

  • Insurance experience in a similar role
  • Customer relationship managment
  • IT proficiency including good knowledge of Microsoft Office applications
  • Fluent written and spoken Maltese and English
  • A good advanced level of education and preferably insurance qualifications

You should be entrepreneurial and enjoy the challenge of a sales job. Should you be selected, full on the job training will be given.

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Allison to finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Consumer Banking Officer
item.description:
A prominent Maltese Bank focused on providing market leading savings products and investment services, currently have a great opportunity for a Consumer Banking Officer to join their established Team;

 

JOB DESCRIPTION

 

The Consumer Banking Officer will form part of a team responsible within the local branch network to promote, sell and maintain relationships with new and existing banking and investment customers.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Working within a team to promote and sell to new and existing customers the Bank’s savings, investment and foreign exchange products
  • Opening and maintaining customers accounts whilst ensuring that existing relationships are kept to high standards by offering a superior customer service
  • Attending to customers at the branch whilst making outbound calls, organising meetings and making outside visits to existing/ potential clients
  • Assisting the Branch Manager / Head of Branch Network to bring on board new customers and build up the client, deposit and investment base

Required knowledge, skills and experience

  • In possession of or studying to obtain a qualification related to Investments such as the Certificate for Financial Advisers (CeFA) or equivalent Diploma/Degree
  • At least 2 years experience working in a bank or financial institution with a desire to work in sales
  • Fluent in written and spoken English and Maltese
  • Ability to work in a target and performance-oriented manner
  • Posesses a customer-centric attitude and approach to sales
  • Possess good verbal and written communication skills with a proven ability to develop and build relationships both internally and externally

 

If you are interested in this role please forward your CV to Allison - amckenzie@castilleresources.com.

item.title: Pensions Administrator
item.description:
The Pensions Administrator will report to the Pensions Supervisor and will handle the daily administration of pension schemes administered by the Company.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

1) Communicating with prospective and existing customers and service providers,;

2) Providing application packs to prospective customers and service providers; 

3) Providing questionnaires to service providers;

4) Setting up terms of business with service providers and investment houses as may be required;

5) Opening files for new customers and service providers;

6) Updating the company’s IT register on a daily basis;

7) Communicating with transferring schemes and processing pension transfer paperwork;

8) Monitoring the progress of the processing of pension transfer requests;

9) Referring any deeds, payment requests, investment requests and any other matters with compliance and/or legal implications to the Compliance Officer;

QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

Experience in administering Qualifying Recognised Overseas Pension Schemes (QROPS) is preferable, but not essential.  Good customer service and communication skills and  attention to detail are essential.

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Allison at finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Junior Pensions Administrator
item.description:
A leading global provider of high-value business services to clients operating and investing globally is seeking to recruit a Pension Scheme Administrator. In this role you will  assist with the on-boarding, general administration and liaison with counter parties of the members’ Pension Retirement Scheme, held on trust.


MAIN DUTIES OF THE POSITION:

  •  Responsibility for a portfolio of Pension Scheme members’ accounts
  •  To ensure regular updates to Scheme members’ records and other databases as required
  •  Liaison with Investment Managers, clients and service providers
  •  Collating of information from Investment Managers and service providers
  •  Assisting with client onboarding, benefit payments, strike-offs and transfers
  •  Opening/closure of Bank accounts, custody accounts and preparation of supporting due diligence documentation
  •  Providing both verbal and written reports to the senior pension scheme administrator

PRINCIPAL QUALIFICATIONS /SKILL SET REQUIRED:

 

  •  Good working knowledge of a busy administrative environment
  •  Capability with respect to Microsoft Office (i.e. Word, e-mail, Excel)
  •  Proactive and willing to take ownership of problems with attention to detail
  •  Ability to manage a large number of projects and issues simultaneously and to tight deadlines
  •  High degree of communication skills, verbal and written with the ability to communicate externally and internally at all levels
  •  Ability to work with multi-cultural teams
  •  Previous experience in similar roles within financial services industry would be a plus

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Allison to finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Senior Investment Administrator
item.description:
A well established Financial Services Company is looking to employ a Senior Investment Administrator.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Responsible for the upkeep of the assets under management report and ensuring that regulatorydeadlines are reached in a timely manner
  • Monitoring of investments and meeting representatives of different investment houses or funds
  • Compilation of data on the investments the trustees usually deal with
  • Support to the Admin Department: assisting in filling application forms with investment houses, answering to investment queries from members/IFA, reviewing of dealing instructions and explaining the investment type
  • Support to the Compliance Department: assisting the compliance officer in handling complaints, risk assessment and other queries
  • Maintaining adequate investments policies and principles

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Mark to finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: HR Business Partner
item.description:
An international Financial Services Company is looking for an experienced HR Business Partner for their Maltese office. You will be part of a challenging environment in an International team atmosphere and spirit, where innovative ideas are supported and highly appreciated.

As HR Business Partner you will be in charge of all HR related topics and will have an opportunity to directly influence the functioning of HR processes and fine-tune the company's established processes.

The main responsibilities are:

  • Managing HR processes from end to end with a high attention to detail and in a collaborative manner
  • Coach and advise managers on HR processes and people management
  • Overall responsibility for the recruitment & selection process
  • Compensation and benefits administration, payroll processing
  • Effective onboarding process - host new joiner training and assure that new employees integrate effectively into the organization
  • Relocation assistance for new employees, if needed
  • Foster relationships with cross-functional stakeholders to build a better employment experience
  • Support with the organization of team events and in house trainings

Requirements:

  • Min 3 years' working experience in a similar role
  • Fluent English both written and spoken is must
  • Ability to travel

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Mark to finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Wealth Relationship Manager
item.description:
The Wealth Relationship Manager will form part of the Consumer Banking team responsible to promote and sell savings, investments and foreign exchange products through effective relationship management with new and existing retail banking customers.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Working within a team to promote and sell the Bank’s wealth management, investment and foreign exchange products to new and existing customers
  • Developing leads and referrals from existing clients through regular client reviews whilst being proactive in the way new clients are onboarded
  • Meeting targets by establishing new relationships and managing existing relationships to increase deposits, generate new assets under custody and revenue from the Bank’s investment and foreign exchange products

Required knowledge, skills and experience

  • Certificate for Financial Advisers (CeFA) or equivalent, to be registered with the MFSA to obtain the required license to provide financial advice
  • At least three years experience working in this field
  • Able to work in a target and performance oriented manner
  • Possess a customer centric attitude and approach to sales
  • Able to develop and build relationships both internally and externally
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both English and Maltese

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Mark at finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Risk Analyst (Insurance)
item.description:
One of the world’s leading insurance companies with over 50 locations around the globe is seeking a Risk Analyst to support proper risk management at its Malta Office based on local regulatory requirements and the standards of the company. He/She shall report and provide support to the Chief Risk Officer and responsibilities will include:

  • maintaining and validating the internal risk model
  • performing the Own Risk and Solvency Assessment (ORSA)
  • assessment of risk (underwriting, market, credit, liquidity, operational, strategic)
  • reviewing of transactions including accumulation control and scenario analysis
  • maintaining the Internal Control System and risk policies
  • maintaining Security & Continuity Risk Management, including IT-Security
  • identifying, monitoring and reporting of risks to various stakeholders

Your Profile:

  • 3 years’ experience within the industry
  • High level University degree or equivalent qualification preferably in mathematics, statistics, economics or insurance
  • Distinctive analytical and conceptual skills
  • Highly motivated, quick learner with the ambition to apply technical skills in a pragmatic way
  • A good understanding of Solvency II is considered an advantage
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools

The successful candidate will be occupying a role providing excellent opportunity for growth and development with a first class international organisation. In-/External Training will be provided where required.

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Mark to finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Commercial Banking Relationship Manager
item.description:
A large International Bank is looking for an experienced client Relationship Manager for their corporate business.                             
                                                                         
The Relationship Manager will manage a portfolio of corporate clients and    
serve as a key player in building customer relationships with a focus on  
client experience and risk management.                                    
                                                                          
Main responsibilities of the role:                                                                            

  • Responsible for the management of a portfolio of customers, including growing the portfolio by deepening and developing existing relationships and prospecting for new customers.                    
  • Building internal and external relationships to deliver high quality customer experience by providing appropriate solutions and services.
  • Following a robust risk management culture and adhering to regulatory requirements.                                            
  • Significant credit risk management.                                                        

      Qualifications & experience:                                                                               

  • Experience in a client relationship management role preferably in Financial Services    
  • Strong communication and influencing skills at all levels, both internally and externally.                                                                                
  • Well organised and able to work under pressure on own initiative to manage competing priorities.                                        
  • Knowledge of different markets, industries and businesses          
  • Knowledge and understanding of financial and business concepts   
  • Professional qualifications relative to the role
  • Eager to develop and embark on a career path

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Mark to finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Personal Assistant
item.description:
Summary of Role

To provide senior level administrative support in a very dynamic executive setting. To play an active role in improving the efficiency of the MD’s Office and senior management within the company. .

Knowledge and Skills 

  • Flawless execution of administrative activities, with high attention to detail and organization
  • Strong team work skills and strong ability to offer suggestions and improvements to process and work effectively with all personalities
  • Ability to be flexible in response to changing needs and priorities of the business
  • Thorough knowledge of office management practices and procedures
  • Ability to handle public relations items
  • Proven ability to manage projects, work under pressure and consistently achieve deadlines
  • Able to handle confidential and sensitive information
  • Educated to a Diploma level or Higher
  • Previous experience of working as a Personal Assistant
  • Extensive Diary management experience, using MS Outlook
  • Excellent organisations skills and an ability to multitask and work within strict time constraints
  • Strong working knowledge of MS Word, Excel, Outlook & PowerPoint

Primary Responsibilities

  • Diary management making appropriate use of time and resources, and carrying out the role of 'gatekeeper', advising others of diary priorities.
  • Planning meetings, visits and events as appropriate, ensuring all details are confirmed and correct
  • Maintaining the Housekeeping of the MD’s office and meetings
  • Organising all travel and accommodation, making best use of the Managing Director’s time
  • Organise papers and briefing notes for meetings. Ensuring briefing and board papers are obtained and presented in an appropriate format and in sufficient time in advance of meetings to allow for reading/preparation
  • Draft as required, high quality and confidential letters, documents and emails within required deadline
  • Print, scan and fax confidential documentation as and when required ensuring that the information remains strictly confidential
  • Anticipate requirements, clarifying as appropriate and sending back items which are not up to par
  • Drafting PowerPoint presentations and collecting information as required
  • Handle incoming and outgoing communications to take initiative in prioritising, channelling and processing telephone calls, messages and correspondence ensuring that draft replies are provided in a timely manner
  • Take the necessary steps in the Managing Director’s absence to ensure calls and messages are responded to
  • Be able to react to constant changes in work load and arrange appointments and meetings at short notice and often at short notice re-arrange meetings and make alternative arrangements for travel and accommodation.
  • Be able to travel within Malta and abroad with the Managing Director as and when required

item.title: Investment Assistant
item.description:
To support the investment function and dealing desk, execution and monitoring of the trading function, maintaining investment portfolio information, and assist with the review of dealing instructions and portfolios.

Core Requirements:

  • Degree in Finance or related fields or relevant working experience.
  • Experience in trading preferred.
  • Good knowledge of Excel.
  • Knowledge of Access considered an asset.

Knowledge and Skills 

  • Knowledgeable in all major asset classes and investment transactions procedure.
  • Able to understand the risks connected to trading procedures.
  • Familiar with all main office productivity software.
  • Experience of office environment.
  • Advanced communication skills.
  • Attention to details, and ability to work under pressure to meet daily deadlines.
  • Ability to set own deadline and work unsupervised

Primary responsibilities

  • Management of the entire dealing process from reception of dealing instructions to execution of orders.
  • Monitoring of dealing instructions’ compliance with statutory and internal investment policies and parameters.
  • Co-ordination of aging debtors dealing instructions.
  • Management of Corporate Action notifications and voluntary actions by relying with relevant IFAs and Investment Houses.
  • Liaise with IFAs, Investment Houses and other external 3rd counterparties.
  • Participation in the monitoring and review of portfolios.
  • Review of IFAs performance.
  • Contributing in the preparation of key investment reports for the management and external stakeholders such as auditors and regulators.

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV for the attention of Mark to finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Administrator (Pensions)
item.description:
Summary of Role

To administer a portfolio of trusts and companies and pensions, handling the diverse needs of a number of private clients with focus on effective service, quality, productivity and efficiency.

  • Educated to A level, with passes in O’Level English and Mathematics
  • Familiar with QROPS
  • Ability to identify risks associated with client transactions
  • Financial Services Background essential
  • Ability to set own deadlines and work accurately to tight deadlines for self and potential reportees

Primary Responsibilities

  • Establish initial administration procedure and maintain office administration in conjunction with the Manager.
  • Liaising with clients and their advisers in respect of service issues, via telephone and other electronic interface.
  • Execution of client transactions
  • Maintain client data within a primary management information system
  • Undertake and manage full time recording and client billing process of self and others
  • Preparation of correspondence with clients and their advisors
  • Ensuring that statutory record are accurate and full audit trail maintained
  • Liaise with intermediary, client and transferring trustees/investment managers whilst transfer proceeding.
  • Provide regular valuations to clients
  • Preparation of payment instructions, and monitoring execution of instructions
  • Preparation of minutes, and ancillary document
  • Production and submission of government returns
  • MFSA/HMRC reporting requirements

If you are interested in this position apply online or send your CV to msims@castilleresources.com

item.title: Affiliate Manager (German Market) - Gaming
item.description:
Our client, an established and expanding Gaming company, is seeking to recruit a German speaking Affiliate Manager.

The successful candidate will be responsible for the recruitment, maintenance and development of affiliates within the German market and beyond.

With sales experience specifically within the Casino industry, the Affiliate Manager will be required to identify opportunities, develop reward concepts for key partners, and enhance the current programme. Applicants must be able to demonstrate excellent people skills, engagement and motivational abilities to drive growth forward.

 

Responsibilities:

  • Overseeing affiliate acquisitions and retention
  • Managing relationships with affiliates, including the recruitment of new affiliate members
  • Constant monitoring of affiliates, reward plans awarded, and placements given to the Company
  • Assessment of traffic and volumes brought by affiliates post-acquisition and handling affiliates struggling with performance accordingly
  • Ensure compliance amongst affiliates with regards to terms and conditions, while analysing activity with optimal reward plans in place
  • Monthly preparation of reports on recently recruited affiliates, promotions, and detailed statistics
  • Preparation of affiliate newsletter each month
  • Meeting personal and departmental KPI’s as assigned by the Company

 

Requirements

  • At least 2 years’ experience in a similar role
  • Solid knowledge of the Casino industry
  • Fluent in German and English (additional languages would be advantageous)
  • Self-motivated and proactive character, driven to produce results
  • Excellent negotiation abilities, with analytical and implementation skills
  • Creative and innovative in approach
  • Able to build and develop strong relationships
  • Sociable and comfortable working in a fast pace small team

 

Should this role be of interest and you would like to be considered, please contact Simon on tech@castilleresources.com

item.title: SENIOR INTERNAL AUDIT EXECUTIVE - BANKING
item.description:
A leading financial institution is seeking to employ an experienced internal auditor with experience audit and credit risk. The right candidate will be joining a highly skilled team of people and will be reporting directly to the Chief Internal Audit Officer of the company.

Reasons why you should join this company:

  • Challenging but rewarding role
  • Career growth and personal development opportunities
  • A market leading salary
  • Working with a highly skilled team under the supervision of the Chief Internal Audit Officer

Duties and responsibilities

•    Building and maintaining professional good working relationships both internally and externally
•    Participating in discussions with key business stakeholders leading to final issue acceptance and remediation
•    Ensuring that proper planning procedures are undergone when carrying out the various audit reviews
•    Identifying effective and efficient control tests, including the development of new audit tools and methodologies to facilitate the identification of risks
•    Standardizing audit programmes to ensure that all significant risks are adequately considered
•    Flow charting of processes to highlight key controls and process weaknesses
•    Evaluating and monitoring business processes and controls and governance practices, through the conduct of Internal Audit reviews
•    Providing feedback and recommendations for improvement whilst ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements and best practices
•    Providing feedback with regard to the setting of resolution deadlines for particular audit findings
•    Supporting other departments to assist the correct implementation of the recommended business processes.
•    Undertaking the necessary continued professional education
•    Other duties as may be determined from time to time by the Chief Internal Audit Officer

Required knowledge, skills and experience

•    A qualification in Audit or Accountancy (ACA/ACCA/IIA)
•    Strong knowledge of credit risk and controls and a working knowledge of relevant areas of regulation
•    Strong analytic skills and familiarity with current credit risk practices and credit risk mitigation techniques would also be valuable
•    Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
•    Knowledge of credit or lending banking products

item.title: Software Solutions Manager
item.description:
Are you a senior developer with Project management skills?

This role could be you’re the next step in your career.

Reporting directly to the CTO, you will be responsible for managing, planning, organising, directing and project managing operations of the Software Solutions function.

Ideal Candidate will have:

  • IT qualification or a related discipline

  • Keep up to date with the required technology in order to provide adequate technical advice as necessary (Operating Systems, Databases and hardware)
  • Responsible to communicate, co-ordinate and implement routine updates/patches/new features with suppliers
  • Propose new better ways of working for improving the system/existing processes as required

Ideal Candidate will have:

  • I.T. related professional degree or equivalent professional experience
  • Knowledge of Billing Systems (considered an asset)
  • Experience using Linux and Windows operating systems
  • Knowledge of Unix shell scripting
  • Experience working with SQL queries and development of PL/SQL applications
  • Administration of Oracle Databases. Hands on experience in application servers (e.g. Apache Tomcat and Microsoft IIS, Servers)  (considered an asset)
  • Minimum basic knowledge of IP protocols
  • Ability to plan work accurately whilst maintaining a certain degree of flexibility in order to deliver on Market requirements

For more information contact Kamilla on tech@castilleresources.com

item.title: Head of Accounts
item.description:
Seeking a Head of Accounts to join one of Malta's most prestigious Corporate Services Provider.  The successful candidate must  come  with the right mindset to organising and running a commercially and technically sound department. 

Responsibilities will be to: 

  • Plan and manage work streams
  • Supervise the team ( circa 12 persons)
  • Oversea work and sign off accounts 
  • Manage training plans and program

The Head of accounts is expected to technically competent and up to date with IAS and IFRS  and have a good knowledge of Tax Accounting

 

Qualifications required:

  • Must be a fully qualified Accountant
  • Have the ability to train junior staff,
  • Meet and maintain the high standards offered by said Client

 

For more information, please contact Nikki on finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Banking Advisory Manager
item.description:
Our client is a leading international firm with offices around the world. They are seeking to strengthen their Banking Advisory due to the growth for this line of service.

This is an exciting new opportunity and would be a great career move for the right person.

 

Skills and Experience Required:

  • exceptional analytical and communication skills (oral and written) with a strong attention for detail
  • ability to gather, verify and analyse information, formulate views and develop and communicate well-rounded conclusions
  • client focus, with ability to work quickly and establish effective working relationships
  • logical and methodical approach to problem solving
  • project management and organisational skills
  • ability to work in a fluid dynamic environment where change is the order of the day

The selected candidate will be responsible for:

  • effectively overseeing and executing engagements including interacting with clients at appropriate levels, preparing financial models, analyzing financial information, and preparation of deliverables including reports, presentations and discussions with the client
  • training and mentoring junior team members
  • actively continuing personal development and learning
  • understanding the capabilities of the firm and looking for opportunities to sell additional services to our clients.

Qualifications Required

  • Candidates should have a professional qualification (Degree in Accountancy, Banking, Finance, or Economics, ACCA, ACA, CFA, FRM or equivalent) and have a minimum of five years' experience in a professional environment. 
  • Candidates having banking regulatory and advisory experience will be given preference.

 

Why should you join this company ?

  • Opportunities for travel on international assignments from time to time
  • Attractive salary remuneration
  • Top class training and support
  • Long term growth opportunities
  • Working with leading local and international clients
  • Job security and stability

item.title: Senior Audit Manager
item.description:
Salary and benefits will range depending on the candidate's experience. skills, qualifications and current earnings. This is an excellent opportunity for someone seeking to make the next step in their career.

This role requires an individual with:

  • A proven career within the audit practice,
  • Having a minimum of 7 years audit experience,
  • With a deep understanding of IFRS and having held an equivalent position within an audit firm.
  • Candidates must be qualified accountants and are required to have broad audit experience on a variety of clients
  • Candidates are expected to have strong project management skills
  • Must have previous experience in managing a varied portfolio of clients and will be reporting directly to an audit director.

item.title: Quality Assurance Executive
item.description:
Currently looking for a Quality Assurance Team Executive: 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Responsibilities include:

  • Creating and managing test plans together with task assignments.
  • Reviewing work progress and making regular recommendations for team, process and solution improvements.
  • Extracting and reporting status updates to the QA Team Lead
  • Problem solving and root cause analysis.
  • Ensuring that products / services are quality tested, meet the agreed functional / non-functional specifications and to ensure that the delivered product is fit for purpose.
  • Contributing to the delivery of new products / services
  • Managing  “post-launch project review”
  • Regular adherence with QA Policies and Procedures

 

The ideal candidate will have:

  • A degree or an equivalent certification in Computer Science or a related field;
  • At least 2 years’ experience in a software testing or a similar role
  • Exposure to modern testing methodologies and testing automation tools (including scripting).
  • Excellent troubleshooting skills to analyse root cause complex issues;
  • Experience in building test plans and related tools such as MS Project;

Should you be interested, get in touch for more information.Email Veronique on tech@castilleresources.com

item.title: Accounting Manager - Insurance
item.description:
A leading insurance company is seeking to employ an Accounts Manager to join their team of professionals, servicing international clients. This role will give great exposure to the chosen candidate and will involve building and maintaining relationships with clients long term.

Why should you join this company?

  • Continuous exposure to clients
  • International client exposure
  • Stable and growing company
  • Professional working environment
  • Long term growth opportunities
  • Above market salary and remunerations

 

Main Responsibilities

  • Approve reconciliation of bank accounts
  • Check monthly posting of bank and investment transactions
  • Monitor cash requirements of the companies
  • Check the management and statutory accounts prepared by accounting associates.
  • Assist with/or prepare the CBM returns, Annual Regulatory returns and Quarterly Solvency returns
  • Monitoring of client solvency and capital requirements
  • Obtaining regulatory approval of changes to business plan
  • Obtaining board approval for underwriting decisions
  • Ensure the production of management accounts, statutory accounts and information, budgets, cash flow statements and supplementary information as required.
  • Assist with the adoption of appropriate accounting practices and ensure adherence thereto.
  • Manage cash requirements of the companies
  • Liaise with and monitor investment managers in respect of invested funds
  • Maintain contact with all client contacts, board directors and officers and advise them of developments
  • Co-ordinate client and board meetings
  • Ensure timely production of board packs (minimum 7 days prior to meeting)
  • Ensure timely production of minutes and review prior to distribution
  • Action matters arising from client meetings
  • Ensure relevant company secretarial functions are performed in a timely manner and take on the Company Secretary role as necessary
  • Ensure compliance with Corporate Governance
  • Maintain ongoing relationships with clients
  • Speak at least monthly with the client and visit client as required
  • Establish good relationship with key clients, regulatory and service providers

 

Qualifications and Experience

  • Degree in Accounting /or ACCA & CPA
  • 5-10 years insurance experience or financial services  industries
  • Knowledge of captive insurance industry considered a large asset
  • Excellent Client Service and interpersonal skills; comfortable dealing directly with clients
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Advanced presentation skills
  • Compliance knowledge
  • Can solve moderately complex issues through experience

item.title: Fund Accounting Manager
item.description:
Want to work in a successful funds company?

Willing to work among highly qualified and experienced multi-lingual professionals? We are currently looking for a fund accounting manager to join a formidable team. 

 

Role and Responsibilities

  • Daily management of the fund accounting and shareholder services teams & Prepare/Review and present financial statements.
  • Preparation and review of NAV calculations and financial reporting & invoice processing.
  • Perform quality and compliance assurance checks.
  • Bank, inter-company, assets and investments reconciliations. 
  • Review, prepare and present monthly cash flow reports, KPI reports and other investment reporting as requested for monthly/quarterly meetings for the funds’ investment strategy committees and board of directors. 
  • Liaise with the shareholders services team in relation to subscriptions and redemptions and related charges and commissions. 
  • Oversee and review the shareholder and compliance services team with preparation of dealing summaries, monthly statements, contract notes, share register updating and any client acceptance and due diligence procedures.
  • Be the key person from the Fund Administrator to ensure and oversee the smooth completion of annual audits including finalization of all financial statements prior to review by the external auditors to ensure completeness and accuracy
  • Develop strong knowledge of the client’s operations, underlying asset classes and hedging mechanisms. 

 

Qualifications & Requirements

  • CPA, CA, ACA or ACCA qualified or part-qualified or equivalent.
  • Strong accounting background and accounts preparation experience.
  • 3 years’ work experience in a fund accounting environment is essential; of which at least 1 year as senior fund accountant with experience in managing teams.
  • Previous experience of PFS Paxus integrated fund administration system is an advantage.
  • Excellent MS Excel and strong MS Office required.
  • Strong analytical and organizational skills, ability to manage and track multiple tasks and deliverables simultaneously.
  • Excellent teamwork, team-management, interpersonal, client relationship and communication (written and verbal) skills. 

Why join this company?

  • Luxurious & modern offices.
  • Very good exposure within funds.
  • The candidate will be required to travel occasionally to other offices mainly Spain and UK.
  • Good Salary Package.

If interested contact Andre on finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Client Accountant
item.description:
Our client is as service provider offering a range of innovative and effective services that have widespread appeal to corporations and high net worth individuals. The role is an exciting opportunity that will offer positive challenges, ongoing training and the possibility of International travel from time to time as the work demands.

Main or Key Responsibilities:

  • Postings – to complete bank and VAT postings and reconciliations.
  • Preparation of VAT returns.
  • Accounts – to prepare statutory financial statements from source documentation and liaise with auditors for the completion of the audits.
  • Interim accounting assignments – to prepare management accounts as above and other ad-hoc accounting reports as required.
  • System development – to appropriately report deficiencies; to contribute to strategies to resolve deficiencies identified.
  • Other responsibilities – to assist in other technical and administrative areas within the Company as may reasonably be requested, having regard to level of work and existing work areas.

Experience and qualifications:

  • At least 2 years’ experience in an accounting environment and may hold a relevant accounting qualification.
  • Experience in fiduciary and trusts will be considered an asset.
  • Good working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel.

Personal Attributes:

The ideal candidate must be a team player who can work on own initiative, with the ability to work under pressure while adhering to tight deadlines. Must have a pro-active and problem solving approach and be able to adapt to change. Organizational and communication skills, both written and verbal and accuracy and attention to detail are of utmost importance

item.title: Finance Officer - Banking
item.description:
One of Malta's leading financial institutions is seeking to employ a Finance Officer to join their growing team.

Job responsibilities:

  • Uploading postings whilst ensuring that these are approved and reflected in the Bank’s general ledger;
  • Reviewing suspense, intercompany and similar types of accounts to ensure that these are cleared precisely.
  • Reviewing bank reconciliations to ensure accounting records are being appropriately managed;
  • Maintaining the banking and accounting system of the Group entities’ general ledger, inter-system reconciliation and related tasks
  • Preparing monthly management and variances reports
  • Preparing VAT returns and assisting with withholding tax queries and returns;
  • Opening new general ledger accounts as required
  • Assisting in the testing of new products or any other amendments required to the systems;
  • Assisting with any regulatory reporting requirements
  • Assisting with the annual / interim audits /reviews
  • Performing other related duties as required, which may include payroll accounting and completion of tax returns
  • Documenting the Finance department’s policies and procedures
  • Other duties as may be determined from time to time by the Chief Financial Officer

Required knowledge, skills and experience:

  • Partly qualified/studying to obtain ACCA qualification or similar
  • Advanced level in Accounting 
  • Good knowledge of accounting specifically IFRS  
  • Proficiency in Microsoft applications (in particular MS Excel) 
  • Attention to detail

If you are interested in this position, kindly apply online.

item.title: Fund Accountant Senior
item.description:
Want to work with the leading recognized fund administrators in Malta? Apply within as this knowledgeable team of accountants and professionals is seeking to take on board a Senior Fund Accountant.

 

Job Responsibilities:

  • To ensure well timed and proper NAV calculation on a weekly or monthly basis
  • Handling of security and cash activity for portfolios
  • Reconciliation of the portfolio from broker to in-house structure.
  • Responding to client queries in a timely manner.
  • Ensuring proper compliance with regulatory needs and other requirements of the funds specifications
  • Detailed revision of NAV calculations for Hedge Funds
  • Preparation of financial statements as required
  • Supervision and training of Fund Accounting staff

 

Skills required:

  • 2-3 years’ experience in a similar role.
  • Be able to meet agreed deadlines
  • Experience in private equity is necessary.
  • An accountancy qualification would be an asset.
  • Excellent interpersonal and written communications skills
  • Strong PC skills including Word, Excel

item.title: Accounts Clerk - International Firm
item.description:
We are a global consultancy firm specializing in investment programs. We are currently looking to employ an accounts clerk to join our offices in Malta.

Job Duties include:

  • Must be able to work on own initiative with limited supervision

  • Compile and Analyze financial information

  • Prepare general ledger accounts

  • Produce monthly reports as instructed

  • Preparation of revenue, expenses, invoices and other accounts docs

  • Process payments

  • To assist in the development and maintenance of financial databases, computer software systems and manual filing systems

  • Assisting the accounts team

  • To provide support and to assist in the establishment of new business in any foreign country

Credentials and Employment experience:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication of Maltese and English

  • Accounting background at Diploma level

  • At least 5 year experience in a similar role

  • IT literate and experience in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Database Management and other software applications

item.title: Account Manager - Insurance
item.description:
Our Client operating within the Insurance sector, is seeking to recruit an Account Manager to support the growth strategy in new products and services diversification. 

Responsibilities will be:

  • To manage existing accounts in Spain and Portugal,
  • To follow implementation and foresee any bottleneck so as to anticipate action plan and to help these accounts grow.

This will involve working with insurance teams at global and local level, and travelling frequently (at least once a month) to Spain and Portugal.

The ideal candidate will have:

  • +4 years' experience in an Account Management role
  • Good understanding of affinity and B to B to C insurance
  • Good writing and speaking knowledge of Portuguese, Spanish and English is essential
  • Well organized & excellent communicator
  • Sales skills – result oriented character

For more information please contact Nikki on finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Head of Syndicated Loan Closer
item.description:
A leading bank is seeking a Head of Syndicated Loan Closer. This person will be leading a team responsible for closing off syndicate loan trades. The team is mainly responsible for managing the flow of trade information, preparing and setting-up trade bookings and settlements, maintaining detailed and accurate trade records as well as monitoring the distribution of trade knowledge throughout the required areas.

Some duties and responsibilities:

  • Ensuring expedite settlement of unsettled trades through handling of syndicate loans documentation (including but not limited to: Trade Confirmation, Assignments, Novations & Transfer Certificates, Pricing letter / Funding Memos)
  • Monitoring settlement of loan trade and following up on any delayed settlements whilst ensuring that loan trade settlements are reflected accurately and timely in the Bank’s current loan system and following up on any updates/ corrections required.
  • Recording of any inaccuracies/ delayed updates

 

The ideal candidate will have:

  • Knowledge of LMA Standard documentation and awareness of LSTA
  • A certification in Credit and Loan Administration and LMA
  • Proficient in Microsoft Excel
  • Previous experience in similar loan closure role

For  more details please contact Nikki on finance@castilleresources.com

item.title: Castille Internship Program – Tech
item.description:
Castille is looking for aspiring young interns from different educational systems with a genuine interest in Software Development & Technology Internships on a short or long term placement. The purpose of the Castille Intern Program is to provide students with an opportunity to enhance and apply what they learn in their academic setting by working in an organization which offers the student a structured real life work experience. Duration of the program is flexible and will be agreed upon by all parties before the internship begins.

During this work experience students would:

  • Gain valuable work experience
  • Build contacts
  • Apply classroom knowledge
  • Get a glimpse of future opportunities for professional growth & development
  • Get a realistic preview of what it is like to work in a professional service organisation

Interested candidates are invited to apply online on www.castilleresources.com and send an email on intern@castilleresources.com. We will contact candidates when we find the ideal internship for them.
